summary: A break-statement causes execution to immediately exit the nearest enclosing loop.
details: A break-statement cannot be used to exit an invocation.
static-checks: A break-statement must be in the body of a loop.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    var i = 0;%0A%0A    while (i < 100)%0A    {%0A        F::println(%22i = %22 .. i);%0A%0A        when (i == 5) then break;%0A%0A        i = i + 1;%0A    }%0A}
